abstract.p: Correction of June 28 article on companies that make enterprise application integration software, which confused Denver, Colo, company, New Era of Networks, commonly called NEON, with NEON Systems of Sugarland, Tex (S)

block.p: An article last Sunday about companies that make enterprise application integration software -- programs that let different software applications work with one another -- misidentified a company on which an analyst, Rehan Syed of SG Cowen, has a buy recommendation. It is New Era of Networks of Denver, commonly called NEON, not NEON Systems of Sugarland, Tex., another company in the sector; Mr. Syed does not follow NEON Systems.
A chart accompanying the article, which showed the stock price of NEON Systems, was labeled correctly.
